bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Wickliffe Rose, April 2, 1921

div1.p: Carter thanks Rose for a reimbursement check.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Wickliffe Rose, April 2, 1921
div1.opener:
Rx
ReRayfare
The Lonsdale, Apt. 206,
Washington, D. C.
April 2, 1921.
Dr. Wickliffe Rose, General Director,
International Health Board,
61 Broadway,
New York, N. Y.
Dear Doctor Rose:
div1.p:
Enclosed please find check in your favor for $14.84, reimburse-
ment for railroad fare and Pullman from New York to Washington. I
thank you for the accommodation and all of your courtesies. I arrived
on time and as soon as the house and street cease to go up and down
will be in normally good condition.

3 I don't see any obligation on the Foundation to make good what
I lost by my advancing money for Payrolls etc. Had the Peruvian
government done so, it might well have been equity. Technically,
however, even they owe me nothing as I paid myself back every pound
I advanced--only I bought £ p. s--393 of them--with dollars at $4.90-4,729
and had to buy back dollars with £ p. s at $3.88.
